item.title: Cryptape è¿œç¨‹èŒä½æ‹›è˜ï¼š Blockchain/Rust Software Engineer
item.content:encoded:
About Cryptape

Cryptape is a leading company dedicated to advancing blockchain technology, focused on the development of the Nervos CKB and key technologies within its ecosystem. We firmly believe in the power of decentralization and drive global blockchain industry growth through continuous technological innovation. We are looking for passionate individuals eager to grow in blockchain technology to join our core team and explore the challenges within the Nervos CKB ecosystem.

  • Website: https://www.cryptape.com/
  • Code: https://github.com/nervosnetwork/ckb
  • Blog: https://blog.cryptape.com/

Job Description

As a CKB Apprentice, you will join our core team and directly participate in the core technology development and optimization of the Nervos CKB (Common Knowledge Base) . Through our training and apprentice program, you will receive in-depth training in blockchain core technologies, smart contract development, and related fields. You will work under the guidance of senior developers, participating in real-world projects and problem-solving tasks. You will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of blockchain protocol operations and accumulate valuable technical experience.

Key Responsibilities

  • Learn and deeply understand the architecture of Nervos CKB, consensus mechanisms, and their relationship with blockchain technology
  • Assist in the development and optimization of Nervos CKB, addressing technical challenges
  • Participate in team technical discussions and code reviews to enhance technical skills
  • Complete assigned tasks in projects and make improvements based on feedback
  • Contribute to technical documentation and knowledge-sharing activities within the team
  • Propose your technical insights and participate in innovative practices

Requirements

  • 2+ years experience in the software development field.
  • Strong interest in blockchain technology and a basic understanding of blockchain principles
  • Proficiency in at least one system programming language (Rust, C++, etc. preferred)
  • Solid foundation in programming, data structures, and algorithms
  • Good reading comprehension of English technical documents
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with team members to solve problems
  • High self-motivation and learning ability to work independently with minimal supervision

Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous involvement in open-source projects, demonstrating a commitment to collaborative development.
  • Knowledge of cryptography and security protocols relevant to blockchain technology, enhancing the security of the Nervos CKB ecosystem.
  • Experience in lower-level computer systems, computer architecture, or embedded systems, contributing to the optimization of Nervos CKB performance.
  • Experience with projects involving handwritten assembly languages, providing insights into low-level optimization techniques.
  • Strong background in operating systems and compilers, with proficient use of Linux.
  • Previous experience as a maintainer of open-source libraries in esoteric languages, showcasing a diverse skill set and commitment to community-driven development.

What We Offer

  • Comprehensive blockchain technology training and one-on-one mentorship
  • Ongoing career development opportunities and potential for advancement
  • The opportunity to work on cutting-edge blockchain technology development
  • Flexible working hours with remote work options
  • A collaborative and supportive team environment with opportunities for cross-team engagement

How to Apply

If you are passionate about blockchain technology and eager to grow in the development of the Nervos CKB, please send your resume and a cover letter to join@cryptape.com, briefly introducing your interests and background.

Can I use AI to get on the global leaderboard? Please don't use AI / LLMs (like GPT) to automatically solve a day's puzzles until that day's global leaderboards are full. By "automatically", I mean using AI to do most or all of the puzzle solving, like handing the puzzle text directly to an LLM. The leaderboards are for human competitors; if you want to compare the speed of your AI solver with others, please do so elsewhere. (If you want to use AI to help you solve puzzles, I can't really stop you, but I feel like it's harder to get better at programming if you ask an AI to do the programming for you.)

Be Part of the Future || Top Silicon Valley Company
We are a tech company located in Silicon Valley, USA, co-founded by senior experts from Palo Alto (home to international companies like Apple, Google, Facebook, Logitech, Tesla, PayPal as well as Stanford University) and other top experts from various countries.

The AI market has grown from 136 billion US dollars in 2022 to 207.9 billion US dollars in 2024, representing a 52% increase in just two years. It is predicted that the global AI market will reach 2 trillion US dollars by 2029.

Advantages:
1 The team holds both Chinese and US patents
2 The team possesses a gaming team with over 30 years of experience
3 The team has senior AI/AGI experts, led by industry leaders
4 The team integrates resources from multiple countries and regions


This project, which is at the forefront of AI model development, represents a major leap forward in the virtual world.
This project will make the multiverse a reality, let us write history together.
The project has authorized patents (international) in AGI, and the team has over 30 years of game development experience (mainly overseas games, English-Speaking).
1 Product Partner, should be a product manager capable of building from zero to one (preferably with AI project experience or game project experience)
2 Technical Co-founders or Entrepreneur (specializing in AI, full-stack development, and various other technical directions)
3 Art Director Partners (Creative Helmsmen, Fountain of Inspiration, Where Art and Commerce Flourish)
4 Game Partners (Implementing AGI Technology in Games. Developing a New AI Model (Patented in China and the U.S.) Applicable to Games, Films, and More)
In general, we welcome all kinds of high-level talents /::D

SEND YOUR RESUME TO INFO@MARV.EE

item.title: [JavaScript] Python ä»£ç è½¬æ¢ä¸º Javascript è¿ç®—ç»“æœä¸ä¸€è‡´
item.content:encoded:
def cid_hash_file(path):
    h = hashlib.sha1()
    size = os.path.getsize(path)
    with open(path, 'rb') as stream:
        if size < 0xF000:
            h.update(stream.read())
        else:
            h.update(stream.read(0x5000))
            stream.seek(int(size/3))
            h.update(stream.read(0x5000))
            stream.seek(size-0x5000)
            h.update(stream.read(0x5000))
    return h.hexdigest().upper()

ä¸Šé¢çš„ä»£ç ç”¨ chatGPT è½¬æ¢åæ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„

function cidHashFile(path) {
  const h = crypto.createHash('sha1');
  const size = fs.statSync(path).size;
  const stream = fs.createReadStream(path);

  if (size < 0xF000) {
    stream.on('data', (chunk) => {
      h.update(chunk);
    });
  } else {
    stream.on('data', (chunk) => {
      if (stream.bytesRead <= 0x5000) {
        h.update(chunk);
      } else if (stream.bytesRead >= Math.floor(size / 3) && stream.bytesRead < Math.floor(size / 3) + 0x5000) {
        h.update(chunk);
      } else if (stream.bytesRead >= size - 0x5000) {
        h.update(chunk);
      }
    });
  }

  stream.on('end', () => {
    const result = h.digest('hex').toUpperCase();
    console.log(result);
  });

  stream.on('error', (err) => {
    console.error('File reading error:', err);
  });
}

item.title: [Sketch] Hiring iOS Engineer UI Designer
item.content:encoded:
iOS Engineer

Job Responsibilities:
1.Complete the design and development of related products on the IOS platform; Responsible for IOS tool application development.
2. Cooperate with product manager and UI design to complete high-quality applications.
Job Requirements:
1, 5 years or above IOS APP development experience, computer related bachelor degree.
2. Familiar with IOS App development technology, proficient in the use of IOS development tools and testing tools.
3, have a systematic grasp of network, multi-line programming and other basic knowledge.
4, Proficient in Objective-C/Swift development experience or experience in flutter development projects.
5, Familiar with app store listing rules, have successfully listed in the app store products are preferred.
6. Positive and optimistic, strong sense of responsibility, careful and meticulous work, good team communication and collaboration skills.
7. Love mobile product research and development, have strong learning ability, have strong curiosity, curiosity and initiative, and can pay attention to and learn the latest mobile development technology in the industry.



UI Designer

Job Description and Requirements
According to the requirements of self-developed products, complete mobile app UI design;
it's important to stay up-to-date with the latest and greatest design trends.
Required Skills and Qualifications
3 years of experience as an UI-UX Designer or similar role,

item.title: Tattooideas.design - Free AI Tattoo Designer
item.content:encoded:
As a tattoo enthusiast who spent months searching for the perfect design, I noticed how challenging it was to translate ideas into actual tattoo artwork. Many people struggle with this creative gap between concept and visualization.

I built https://tattooideas.design/ to solve this problem - a free AI tool that helps you visualize your tattoo ideas instantly. No more endless Pinterest scrolling or expensive consultation fees just to explore concepts.

Key features:

  • Multiple tattoo styles (American Traditional, Neo Traditional, Minimalist, etc.)
  • Custom size/placement optimization
  • High-resolution, watermark-free designs
  • No registration required
  • Completely free to use

What makes it unique:

  • Instant visualization of your concepts
  • Style-specific design generation
  • Body placement optimization
  • Professional-quality output

Give it a try and let me know your thoughts! I'd love feedback on:

  • Which styles would you like to see added?
  • What features would make the design process better?
  • How could we improve the output quality?

Thanks for checking it out! ğŸ™

item.title: [åˆ†äº«åˆ›é€ ] Welcome to Sprunki Corruptbox
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to Sprunki Corruptbox

Sprunki Corruptbox is an innovative remix-driven game that invites players to unleash their musical creativity while navigating through a world of unpredictable glitches. In this unique experience, you can assemble various Sprunki-themed characters, each contributing distinct sounds and beats to create dynamic musical compositions.

Key Features

  • Character Assembly: Drag and drop different Sprunki characters onto the stage, each adding its unique sound to your mix.
  • Corruption Mechanics: Experience random glitches that alter sounds and visuals, requiring you to adapt your strategies on the fly.
  • Creative Sharing: Save and share your corrupted musical creations with friends and the online community, fostering collaboration and creativity.
  • Unpredictable Sound Design: Enjoy a soundtrack filled with glitchy, experimental beats that create a tense and chaotic atmosphere.
  • Surreal Visuals: Immerse yourself in mesmerizing visuals that match the unsettling soundtrack, enhancing your overall experience.

Join us in the world of Sprunki Corruptbox, where music meets chaos, and every session is a new adventure!

å¯èƒ½å¾ªç¯ä¸ª 10 æ¬¡ä¼šé‡åˆ°ä¸€ä¸¤æ¬¡ï¼Œå†…å­˜ä¹Ÿå¤Ÿç”¨ catch TargetCloseError: Protocol error (Emulation.setTouchEmulationEnabled): Session closed. Most likely the page has been closed.

for (let index = i; index < urls.length; ) {
      let item = urls[index];

      const page = await browser.newPage();
      page.setDefaultTimeout(0);  
      page.setDefaultNavigationTimeout(0);
      await page.setViewport({ width: 1080, height: 1024 });

      await page.goto(item, {
        waitUntil: "domcontentloaded",
        protocolTimeout: 600000,
      });
      console.log("goto");
xxxxx...

item.title: [åˆ†äº«åˆ›é€ ] GenChess - Free AI Chess Piece Generator
item.content:encoded:
As a chess enthusiast, I noticed that while chess sets come in many designs, there wasn't a way for players to create truly personalized pieces. I spent six months building GenChess, an AI-powered platform that lets you design custom chess pieces through simple text prompts.

Key features:

  • AI-powered customization with text prompts
  • Classic and creative design modes
  • Individual piece regeneration
  • Multiple style presets (medieval, futuristic, etc.)
  • Free to use

GenChess transforms abstract ideas into unique chess pieces. Want Star Wars-themed bishops? Pizza-shaped pawns? Just describe your vision and watch it come to life. Try it out and let me know what creative chess sets you design! I'd love feedback on making GenChess even better. What themes would you like to see added?

Website: https://www.genchess.net/

item.content:encoded:
é—®é¢˜æè¿°ï¼ša æœåŠ¡å™¨çš„ nginx æœåŠ¡ä¼šå°† /aisp/approval/ è·¯å¾„çš„è¯·æ±‚è½¬å‘ç»™æˆ‘ï¼Œæˆ‘æ”¶åˆ°è¯·æ±‚åæ ¹æ®user-agentåˆ¤æ–­æ˜¯ç§»åŠ¨ç«¯è¿˜æ˜¯ pc ç«¯è¯·æ±‚ï¼Œå¦‚æœä¸ºç§»åŠ¨ç«¯çš„ï¼Œåˆ™å»å½“å‰æœåŠ¡å™¨çš„/home/centos/web/h5ç›®å½•ä¸‹å“åº”å¯¹åº”çš„é™æ€æ–‡ä»¶ã€‚å¦‚æœæ˜¯/aisp/approval/api/è·¯å¾„ä¸‹çš„è¯·æ±‚åˆ™è¯·æ±‚åç«¯æœåŠ¡ï¼Œå½“å‰çš„é…ç½®ï¼š

server {
        listen 9999;
        server_name localhost;

        location /aisp/approval/ {
            if ($is_mobile = 0) {
                rewrite ^/aisp/approval/(.*)$ https://b.com/$1 permanent;
            }
            alias /home/centos/web/h5/;
            try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;
        }

        location  /aisp/approval/api/ {
            limit_conn perip 1000;
            proxy_pass http://10.156.166.23:9088/;
            proxy_redirect off;
            proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
            proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
            proxy_set_header Host $host;
            client_max_body_size 600M;
            client_body_buffer_size 512k;
        }
    }

item.content:encoded:
class AreaManager {
    companion object {
        @Volatile
        private var instance: AreaManager? = null

        @JvmStatic
        fun getInstance(): AreaManager {
            return instance ?: synchronized(this) {
                instance ?: AreaManager().also { instance = it }
            }
        }
    }
    suspend fun updateArea(context: Context): Boolean {
        val filePath = downloadFile(context)
        return when (filePath) {
            null -> false
            else -> true
        }
    }
}

éœ€è¦æœ‰ä¸€å°å¯ä»¥æ­£å¸¸è®¿é—® https://hub.docker.com/ çš„æœåŠ¡å™¨ï¼Œæˆ‘ç”¨çš„æ˜¯åä¸ºäº‘é¦™æ¸¯ï¼Œç”¨çš„å¼€å‘è€…è®¤è¯é€çš„ 401 å…ƒæ— é—¨æ§›ä¼˜æƒ åˆ¸å¼€é€šäº† 11 ä¸ªæœˆï¼ŒåŒºåŸŸ ä¸­å›½-é¦™æ¸¯ 2 æ ¸ | 2GiB | ç³»ç»Ÿç›˜ 40GiB | æµé‡åŒ… 1,024GB | å³°å€¼å¸¦å®½ 30Mbit/s

set_real_ip_from 0.0.0.0/0;
real_ip_header CF-Connecting-IP;
client_max_body_size 2G;
underscores_in_headers on;
resolver 8.8.8.8 ipv6=off;
resolver_timeout 10s;

proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
proxy_set_header Connection $http_connection;
proxy_set_header Accept-Encoding "";
proxy_ssl_session_reuse off;
proxy_ssl_server_name on;

proxy_http_version 1.1;
proxy_buffering off;
proxy_request_buffering off;
proxy_max_temp_file_size 0;

proxy_connect_timeout 864000s;
proxy_read_timeout 864000s;
proxy_send_timeout 864000s;
send_timeout 864000s;

location /v2/ {
    proxy_pass https://registry-1.docker.io;
    proxy_set_header Host registry-1.docker.io;

    header_filter_by_lua_block {
        local www_auth = ngx.var.upstream_http_www_authenticate
        if www_auth then
            local new_www_auth = string.gsub(www_auth, "auth.docker.io", "docker.kegui.net")
            # è¿™ä¸ªåœ°æ–¹ ä¸Šé¢çš„ docker.kegui.net éœ€è¦æ”¹æˆè‡ªå·±çš„åŸŸå
            ngx.header['www-authenticate'] = new_www_auth
        end
    }

    proxy_intercept_errors on;
    recursive_error_pages on;
    error_page 301 302 307 = @handle_redirect;
    error_log /dev/null;
    access_log /www/wwwlogs/docker.log;
}

location /token {
    error_log /dev/null;
    access_log /dev/null;
    proxy_pass https://auth.docker.io;
    proxy_set_header Host auth.docker.io;
}

location @handle_redirect {
    set $saved_redirect_location '$upstream_http_location';
    proxy_pass $saved_redirect_location;
}

item.title: [åˆ†äº«åˆ›é€ ] Bypass Cloudflare for GitHub Action Pro
item.content:encoded:
Bypass Cloudflare for GitHub Action Pro

Repo: https://github.com/snowdreamtech/bypass-cloudflare-for-github-action

Marketplace: https://github.com/marketplace/actions/bypass-cloudflare-for-github-action-pro

Never receive 403 Forbidden from Cloudflare again.

Inspired by xiaotianxt/bypass-cloudflare-for-github-action

Requests from GitHub Action servers to a Cloudflare proxied host may be blocked by Cloudflare's Web Application Firewall(WAF) or Bot Fight Mode. This action automatically adds the public IP of the GitHub Action runner to Cloudflare's firewall Custom rules or Lists

Features

  • Automatically retrieves the public IP of the GitHub Action runner.
  • Adds the runner's IP to Cloudflare's firewall custom rules.
  • Adds the runner's IP to Cloudflare's account list.
  • Cleans up by removing the IP from Cloudflare's firewall custom rules after the job is complete.
  • Cleans up by removing the IP from Cloudflare's account list after the job is complete.

Inputs

Input Description Required Default
mode single/list/github false github
cf_zone_id Cloudflare Zone ID true /
cf_api_token Cloudflare API Token true /
cf_account_id Cloudflare Account ID true /
github_api_token Github API Token true /
single_rule_description Rule Description For Mode Single false Bypass Cloudflare for GitHub Action (Single)
list_rule_description Rule Description For Mode List false Bypass Cloudflare for GitHub Action (List)
list_name List name false github_actions_runners
clean Caution: It will remove your zone ruleset rule and your list false false

Outputs

Output Description
time Time when finished.

Usage

To use this action, create a workflow in your repository's .github/workflows directory. Below is an example workflow file:

name: Bypass Cloudflare for Github Action Pro
on: [push]
jobs:
  bypass-cloudflare-for-github-action-pro:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v4.2.1
      - name: Bypass Cloudflare for Github Action Pro
        uses: snowdreamtech/bypass-cloudflare-for-github-action@v0.0.4
        with:
          mode: 'github'
          cf_account_id: ${{ secrets.CF_ACCOUNT_ID }}
          cf_api_token: ${{ secrets.CF_API_TOKEN }}
          cf_zone_id: ${{ secrets.CF_ZONE_ID }}
          github_api_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      - name: Send request to Cloudflare-protected server
        run: curl https://example.com/api

Important Note

This action requires a Cloudflare API Token, not the Global API Key. To create an API token:

  1. Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard.
  2. Go to "My Profile" > "API Tokens".
  3. Click "Create Token".
  4. Create a custom token with the following permissions:
    • Account > Account Filter > Edit
    • Zone > Zone WAF > Edit
    • Zone > Zone Settings > Edit
    • Zone > Zone > Edit
  5. Set the token to access the specific account you're working with.
  6. Set the token to access the specific zone you're working with.
  7. Create the token and save it securely.

Remember to add your Cloudflare Account ID, Cloudflare Zone ID and the new API Token to your GitHub repository secrets as CF_ACCOUNT_ID, CF_ZONE_ID and CF_API_TOKEN respectively.

About the GITHUB_TOKEN secret

At the start of each workflow job, GitHub automatically creates a unique GITHUB_TOKEN secret to use in your workflow. You can use the GITHUB_TOKEN to authenticate in the workflow job.

Before each job begins, GitHub fetches an installation access token for the job. The GITHUB_TOKEN expires when a job finishes or after a maximum of 24 hours.

Limits

The global rate limit for the Cloudflare API is 1200 requests per five minute period per user, and applies cumulatively regardless of whether the request is made via the dashboard, API key, or API token.

If you exceed this limit, all API calls for the next five minutes will be blocked, receiving a HTTP 429 - Too Many Requests response.

import VueScan, { type VueScanOptions } from 'z-vue-scan/src'

item.content:encoded:
#!/bin/bash

# è¾“å‡ºé¢œè‰²
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
RED='\033[0;31m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# æç¤ºç”¨æˆ·æ“ä½œé£é™©
confirm_action() {
    echo -e "\033[1;33m æ³¨æ„: æ­¤è„šæœ¬å°†å®‰è£…å¤šä¸ªå·¥å…·å’ŒæœåŠ¡, å¯èƒ½ä¼šä¿®æ”¹ç³»ç»Ÿé…ç½®, å¸¦æ¥æ½œåœ¨çš„å®‰å…¨é£é™©!!!\033[0m"
    read -p "æ˜¯å¦ç»§ç»­æ‰§è¡Œï¼Ÿ  (y/n): " CONFIRM
    if [[ "$CONFIRM" != "y" ]]; then
        echo "æ“ä½œå·²å–æ¶ˆã€‚"
        exit 0
    fi
}

# æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯å¦ä»¥ root æƒé™è¿è¡Œ
if [ "$(id -u)" -ne 0 ]; then
  echo "è¯·ä»¥ root ç”¨æˆ·è¿è¡Œæ­¤è„šæœ¬!!!"
  exit 1
fi

# æ£€æµ‹æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿå’ŒåŒ…ç®¡ç†å™¨
detect_package_manager() {
    if command -v apt &> /dev/null; then
        PACKAGE_MANAGER="apt"
    elif command -v yum &> /dev/null; then
        PACKAGE_MANAGER="yum"
    else
        echo "æ— æ³•æ£€æµ‹åˆ°æ”¯æŒçš„åŒ…ç®¡ç†å™¨ (apt æˆ– yum), è¯·æ‰‹åŠ¨å®‰è£…å¿…è¦çš„ä¾èµ–ã€‚"
        exit 1
    fi
}
 
# å®‰è£…å¿…è¦å·¥å…·
install_packages() {
    if [ "$PACKAGE_MANAGER" = "apt" ]; then
        curl -fsSL https://pkg.cloudflareclient.com/pubkey.gpg | gpg --yes --dearmor --output /usr/share/keyrings/cloudflare-warp-archive-keyring.gpg
        echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/cloudflare-warp-archive-keyring.gpg] https://pkg.cloudflareclient.com/ $(lsb_release -cs) main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloudflare-client.list
        apt update && apt install -y curl wget unzip openssl cloudflare-warp
    elif [ "$PACKAGE_MANAGER" = "yum" ]; then
        curl -fsSl https://pkg.cloudflareclient.com/cloudflare-warp-ascii.repo | tee /etc/yum.repos.d/cloudflare-warp.repo
        yum install -y epel-release
        yum install -y curl wget unzip openssl cloudflare-warp
    fi
}

# å˜é‡å®šä¹‰
DOMAIN=${1:-"example.com"} # å¦‚æœæœªæä¾›åŸŸåå‚æ•°ï¼Œåˆ™é»˜è®¤ä½¿ç”¨ example.com
DAYS_VALID=365             # è¯ä¹¦æœ‰æ•ˆæœŸï¼ˆå¤©æ•°ï¼‰
CERT_DIR="/usr/local/etc/xray"           # è¯ä¹¦å­˜å‚¨ç›®å½•




# åˆ›å»ºå­˜å‚¨ç›®å½•
mkdir -p ${CERT_DIR}

# ç”Ÿæˆç§é’¥
openssl genrsa -out ${CERT_DIR}/${DOMAIN}.key 2048

# ç”Ÿæˆè¯ä¹¦ç­¾åè¯·æ±‚ï¼ˆ CSR ï¼‰

interface Options<T> {
  a: () => T;
  b: (p: T) => void;
}

function defineItem<T>(options: Options<T>) {
  return options;
}

const config = {
  item1: defineItem({
    a: () => ({ id: 1 }),
    b: (params) => {}, // params ç±»å‹æ˜¯ { id: number }
  }),
  item2: defineItem({
    a: () => ({ name: '1' }),
    b: (params) => {}, // params ç±»å‹æ˜¯ { name: string }
  }),
};

item.title: [é—®ä¸ç­”] Apache Answer è¿™ä¸ªæ’ä»¶æ€ä¹ˆå®‰è£…å‘€ã€‚ã€‚ã€‚
item.content:encoded:
çœ‹äº†ä¸‹æ–‡æ¡£è¦ç”¨ dockerFile

FROM apache/answer as answer-builder

RUN sed -i 's/dl-cdn.alpinelinux.org/mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/g' /etc/apk/repositories

RUN apk --no-cache add \
    build-base git bash nodejs npm go && \
    npm install -g pnpm

RUN go env -w GOPROXY=https://goproxy.cn,direct

RUN answer build \
    --with github.com/apache/incubator-answer-plugins/connector-dingtalk \
    --output /usr/bin/new_answer

FROM alpine

ARG TIMEZONE
ENV TIMEZONE=${TIMEZONE:-"Asia/Shanghai"}

RUN sed -i 's/dl-cdn.alpinelinux.org/mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/g' /etc/apk/repositories

RUN apk update \
    && apk --no-cache add \
        bash \
        ca-certificates \
        curl \
        dumb-init \
        gettext \
        openssh \
        sqlite \
        gnupg \
        tzdata \
    && ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/${TIMEZONE} /etc/localtime \
    && echo "${TIMEZONE}" > /etc/timezone

COPY --from=answer-builder /usr/bin/new_answer /usr/bin/answer
COPY --from=answer-builder /data /data
COPY --from=answer-builder /entrypoint.sh /entrypoint.sh
RUN chmod 755 /entrypoint.sh

VOLUME /data
EXPOSE 80
ENTRYPOINT ["/entrypoint.sh"]

item.title: [åˆ†äº«åˆ›é€ ] Tired of Browsing the Same Sites? Hereâ€™s a Website That Will Change Your Internet Experience
item.content:encoded:
Hey V2EX,

As a frequent browser of the web, I often find myself stuck in the endless loop of visiting the same websites day in and day out. Itâ€™s a cycle Iâ€™m sure many of you are familiar withâ€”Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, and the occasional tech blog. But lately, Iâ€™ve been on the lookout for something different. Something fun, random, and unexpected.

Thatâ€™s when I stumbled upon Random-Websites.com. Itâ€™s a simple website that introduces you to a new, random website every time you refresh the page. You never know what youâ€™re going to getâ€”sometimes itâ€™s a quirky game, sometimes itâ€™s a mind-bending piece of art, and sometimes itâ€™s something completely bizarre that makes you question the internet itself.

Why I Love It: Itâ€™s a Great Distraction: We all need a mental break from work or study, right? A quick visit to a random website is the perfect way to clear your mind and have a laugh (or be confused, which is often just as fun). Perfect for Productivity Breaks: Whether youâ€™re coding, designing, or working on a project, we all know how hard it is to stay focused for long stretches. This site gives you a lighthearted, random experience that refreshes your brain. Never Boring: Iâ€™m someone who often gets bored of scrolling through the same websites over and over again. Random-Websites.com is the cure for that. Every visit feels like an adventure to discover something new. Why Itâ€™s Worth Checking Out: For the V2EX community, I know many of you are into exploring the â€œedgeâ€ of the webâ€”whether itâ€™s cool tech projects, fun little apps, or websites that give a unique experience. Random-Websites.com offers that, and more. Itâ€™s a fun little rabbit hole that never gets old because the content is always changing.

The best part? Itâ€™s completely free and doesnâ€™t require any sign-ups, which is rare these days. If youâ€™re curious about weird corners of the internet and want something that breaks the monotony, this is the site to visit.

Bonus: A Community of Explorers I think V2EX is full of people who appreciate exploring the unknownâ€”whether itâ€™s finding obscure software, hidden tools, or cool websites. If youâ€™ve ever spent hours down a random rabbit hole, Random-Websites.com will feel like a treasure trove of new experiences.

Conclusion: If youâ€™re looking for a simple, fun way to kill time or discover new, random corners of the web, Random-Websites.com is worth checking out. Plus, you never know when youâ€™ll come across your next favorite website!

Anyone else here into exploring random websites? Iâ€™d love to hear some of your favorite obscure websites. Letâ€™s keep the web weird and wonderful.

for (OrgApiManage orgApiManageVo : testApiManageVos) {

    // æ‰§è¡Œä»»åŠ¡å¹¶è·å– Future å¯¹è±¡
    Future<OrgApiManageExecuteVO> f = tpe.submit(c);

log.info("========= ExecuteListSize:{} ====", results.size());
// å…³é—­çº¿ç¨‹æ± 
tpe.shutdown();
// è·å–æ‰€æœ‰å¹¶å‘ä»»åŠ¡çš„è¿è¡Œç»“æœ
for (OrgFutureResult orgFutureResult : results) {
    Future<OrgApiManageExecuteVO> f = orgFutureResult.getF();
    if (f.isDone()) {

        orgApiManageList.add(returnDTO);
    } else {
        log.info("=========== ä»»å‹™æœªå®Œæˆ   æœ€å¤šç­‰å¾… 60 åˆ†é’Ÿ =======");
        try {

}
log.info("======== return orgApiManageList Size:{} =====", orgApiManageList.size());

return orgApiManageList;

Context

I have a Next.js project using next-i18next for multilingual support. Please help me translate my JSON files to implement internationalization. [è¿™é‡Œè¡¥å……ä½ å³å°†ç¿»è¯‘çš„å†…å®¹çš„ä¸»é¢˜]

Requirements:

You are a skilled translator tasked with translating a given text into a specified target language. Your goal is to provide an accurate and natural-sounding translation that captures the meaning and tone of the original text.

Please follow these guidelines when translating:

  1. Maintain the original meaning and intent of the text.
  2. Readability: Reduce complex, lengthy sentences and avoid using obscure words
  3. Accuracy: Avoid literal translations, focus on conveying concepts and intentions
  4. Adapt idioms and cultural references to the target language where appropriate.
  5. Preserve the tone and style of the original text as much as possible.
  6. Ensure proper grammar, spelling, and punctuation in the target language.
  7. Localization: Adapt to the cultural background and habits of the target language, consider using local slang, idioms, and expressions.

Now, please translate the source text into the target language. If it's a sentence, please response with the translation only. If it is just one word, response with explanation and example sentences.

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] æ·±åœ³ï¼š Senior Software Engineer,Trust and Safetyï¼Œè‹±è¯­è¦æ•¢è¯´ä¸ä¸€å®šè¦æµåˆ©
item.content:encoded:
You Will:

Lead Development: Take ownership of building scalable and robust moderation systems addressing complex safety issues across global and China markets.
Tackle Challenges: Solve the most difficult problems in content moderation and user behavior abuse in a dynamic 3D UGC environment.
Empower Teams: Develop tools and intelligent assistants to supercharge human operations teams, enabling them to work with precision and efficiency.
Collaborate Across Borders: Work closely with a passionate and high-performing cross-functional team spanning China and the US.
Grow Your Career: Enjoy the opportunity to fast-track your professional growth while maintaining work-life balance in a Silicon Valley-style culture.
You Have:

Language Proficiency: 4+ years of experience communicating professionally in English, both written and verbal.
Backend Expertise: 4+ years of experience designing, building, and maintaining large-scale, highly available distributed backend services with modern microservice architectures.
Product Delivery: Proven track record of building and shipping production-ready software for at least 4+ years.
Codebase Collaboration: 4+ years of experience contributing to multi-developer codebases, including open-source or personal projects.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in languages such as Golang, Python, or similar.
Data Knowledge: Familiarity with data pipelines and ETL processes.
Safety Systems Interest: A strong interest in Trust & Safety systems.
Mindset: A growth-oriented attitude and eagerness to tackle complex problems.
(Preferred) Experience in the Trust & Safety domain.
(Preferred) Familiarity with frontend development using JavaScript or TypeScript.
(Preferred) Experience applying AI solutions to real-world business challenges.

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] å›½å†…å’Œç¡…è°·çš„ä¸€äº› ai åˆ›ä¸šå…¬å¸æ‹›è˜ï¼šå…¨æ ˆå¼€å‘å·¥ç¨‹å¸ˆã€å¹¿å‘Šåç«¯å¼€å‘å·¥ç¨‹å¸ˆã€æœºå™¨å­¦ä¹ å·¥ç¨‹å¸ˆã€core engineerã€promptã€dataã€game engineer
item.content:encoded:
ä¸€ã€ç¡…è°· ai å¹¿å‘Šåˆ›ä¸šå…¬å¸ï¼Œå²—ä½å¯ä»¥ base ç¡…è°·æˆ–è€…å›½å†… remote åŠå…¬
1. Ads infra engineer
- Responsibility
- Build and scale our AI-native ads system
- Requirements
- Extensive experience with programmatic ad systems
- Familiar with the different players in the ads ecosystem and the business landscape
- Solid understanding of the business logic of programmatic ad systems, including intent recognition, targeting, ad matching, pricing, etc.
- practical experience working in the cloud (GCP, AWS, etc)
- Preferably have experience optimizing low-latency, high-throughput backend optimization
- Our stack is based on Python and Go, experience with other programming languages is a plus
- Ideal candidate
- Have at least 2 years of experience in programmatic ads systems
- Either very young, hungry or very experienced
- Have a holistic view on the programmatic ads ecosystem (not specific to a particular function in big tech), know of technologies like OpenRTB or the practical applications
- Strong interest in GenAI
- Have experience in high-growth team/project at established companies or experience at startup

2. ML engineer
- Responsibility
- Understand business objective, able to independently define metrics, get data, train model, and deliver results
- Build the ads system as well as the LLM-native part
- Based on the data, optimize the system against the metrics, try out different ML algorithms
- Productionize & scale the ML pipeline in a backend system, improve latency
- Requirement
- You either have extensive LLM / Generative image / video experience, or extensive ad system / recommendation system. Ideally both.
- Experience in deep learning architectures and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
- Strong programming skills in Python and proficiency in relevant ML libraries.
- Experience with LLM/NLP is strongly preferred

3. Research engineer - generative video (accept intern/full-time/part-time)
- Responsibility
- Follow cutting-edge results in video generation and video editing
- Build and iterate research prototypes in fast iterations to achieve key business objectives
- Productionize the prototypes with the engineering team and ensure key performance metrics in monetization and user experience
- Note: this role does not involve training foundation models, but rather focuses on building products based on foundation model capabilities
- Requirement
- Strong passion and experience in generative AI, especially in generative video and video editing space
- Experience with leading AI research tech stack, including but not limited to Python, PyTorch, cuda, etc.
- Strong interest in creating real-world impact with cutting-edge AI technology
- Strong communication ability with both verbal and written communications
- (optional) experience building products on top of latest research results, experience with comfyui is a plus

4. ç†Ÿç»ƒæŒæ¡ JS React / Java Spring / Python FastAPI ç­‰å‰åç«¯å¼€å‘æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œèƒ½è¿›è¡Œå…¨æ ˆå¼€å‘ï¼›
5. å¯¹è®¡ç®—æœºç§‘å­¦å’Œäº’è”ç½‘æŠ€æœ¯æœ‰çƒ­æƒ…ï¼Œæ·±åˆ»ç†è§£å„ç§å‰åç«¯æŠ€æœ¯ï¼›
6. å…·å¤‡è‰¯å¥½çš„æœåŠ¡æ„è¯†ã€è´£ä»»å¿ƒã€å¼ºå¤§çš„å­¦ä¹ èƒ½åŠ›ä»¥åŠå‡ºè‰²çš„å›¢é˜Ÿæ²Ÿé€šä¸åä½œèƒ½åŠ›ã€‚

å››ã€ç¡…è°· ai platform åˆ›ä¸šå…¬å¸ï¼Œbase ç¡…è°·æˆ–å›½å†…è¿œç¨‹åŠå…¬
1 ã€core engineer
tldr; we need engineers that are nimble, dynamic, and can take ownership of many parts of the stack. you will be building a platform that affects real users every day.

what youâ€™ll be doing
architecting and implementing stuff that matters
writing a ton of code (our tech stack is
solving hard engineering problems
talking to users to debug

you should probably:
have built real things that real people use (2+ years)
be comfortable with our stack:
typescript + next.js + react
python
postgresQL, scylla, redis, milvus
actually enjoy the chaos of startup life
have experience building with AI - an â€œAI engineerâ€
fix things without being asked
itâ€™s a bonus if you have been a founder/cto in the past

2 ã€prompt engineer / ai specialist
tldr; we need people who really love talking (and whispering) to llms. you will be directly affecting the way that tens of thousands of people everyday talk to ai.

what youâ€™ll be doing
talking with llms to create & refine prompts
brainstorming at the intersection of llms & product
being creative with words
talking to users for fun

you should probably:
be obsessed with LLMs, experimenting with prompts for fun or contributing to communities like SillyTavern, LocalLLaMA, Chub
love tinkering with AI models and exploring their quirks, strengths, and weaknesses.
have a portfolio of creative AI workâ€”whether itâ€™s a clever chatbot, a hobby project, or a library of impressive prompts
view language as both an art and a science

3 ã€ai & data engineer
tldr; we are seeking engineers who love working with data at the cutting edge of artificial intelligence.

what youâ€™ll be doing
designing and building data pipelines to support AI model training, inference
optimizing ai inference and serving
solving gnarly data and infrastructure problems to help our platform scale
staying up to date on cutting-edge research & products in the ai space

you should probably:
have some experience building and maintaining data pipelines and distributed systems (2+ years)
be familiar with training and deploying AI models in production environments
be obsessed with hard problems at the intersection of ai and data engineering
bonus: if youâ€™ve built a neural network or ai recommendation engine from scratch

4 ã€game developer
tldr; weâ€™re looking for a game developer whoâ€™s passionate about blending creativity and technology to build ai-driven gaming experiences. you will be using traditional game engines like unity and blending them with the possibilities enabled by ai.

what youâ€™ll be doing
designing and developing gameplay systems and mechanics powered by ai
rapidly prototyping game features to push the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible with AI in gaming
working with the rest of the team to integrate AI elements like NPCs, dialogue systems, and procedurally generated content into game systems

you should probably:
be skilled in Unity, Unreal Engine, or a similar game engine
have solid programming skills (C#, C++, or Python)
love games and storytelling, with a deep interest in creating unique, AI-enhanced experiences
be curious about ai
